DataElement.preferredName: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Treatment Plan Assessment Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions related to the treatment plan for AML.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Myeloid Leukemia Treatment Plan Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise categorized. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification)._A document outlining the essential treatment issues which will be addressed. This may include the problem to be addressed, the proposed treatment, the treatment goal, the time frame to meet goals, and an estimate of the costs._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues.  The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia 3) Therapy-related AML 4) AML not otherwise categorized.  The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML has been recently reduced from 30% (French-American-British [FAB] classification) to 20% (WHO classification).  (WHO, 2001) -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A clonal expansion of myeloid blasts in the bone marrow, blood or other tissues. The classification of acute myeloid leukemias (AMLs) encompasses four major categories: 1) AML with recurrent genetic abnormalities; 2) AML with multilineage dysplasia; 3) Therapy-related AML; 4) AML not otherwise specified. The required bone marrow or peripheral blood blast percentage for the diagnosis of AML is 20% (WHO classification).

Property.preferredDefinition: A document outlining the essential treatment issues which will be addressed. This may include the problem to be addressed, the proposed treatment, the treatment goal, the time frame to meet goals, and an estimate of the costs.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: A document outlining the essential treatment issues which will be addressed. This may include the problem to be addressed, the proposed treatment, the treatment goal, the time frame to meet goals, and an estimate of the costs.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the participant have pre
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have previously untreated AML and is a candidate for intensive induction chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have previously untreated AML and is a candidate for intensive induction chemotherapy? (Patients are allowed to have had prior hydroxyurea).

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have previously untreated de novo AML with > 20% bone marrow blasts as set out in the WHO Myeloid Neoplasm classification?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COF CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is patient previously untreated for secondary AML?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have previously untreated de novo AML with greater than or equal to 20% bone marrow blasts as set out in the WHO Myeloid Neoplasm classification?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have previously untreated de novo AML and meets the criteria for AML with greater than or equal to 20% bone marrow blasts as set out in the WHO Myeloid Neoplasm classification?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have previously untreated de novo AML and meets the criteria for AML with greater than or equal to 20% bone marrow blasts as set out in the WHO Myeloid Neoplasm classification?
